definition[0]: to start to use something again that was used in the past
example[0]: The city council has decided to bring back the old electric trams.
example[1]: Bringing back the death penalty has done absolutely nothing to reduce crime.
example[2]: The trip brought back a lot of happy memories.
example[3]: Seeing those pictures on TV brought it all back to me.
definition[2]: to take something or someone with you when you come back from somewhere
example[4]: Don’t forget to bring something back for the kids.
example[5]: If you’re going to the store, could you bring me back a six-pack?
definition[3]: to return someone to their previous job or position of authority
example[6]: Following their latest defeat, soccer fans are urging the club to bring back the former manager.
definition[4]: if something that is said brings you back to a particular subject, it is connected with that subject, so you will start talking about it again
example[7]: This brings us back to the question of funding.
